interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: LEGO Ninjago: The Complete First Season (DVD)
Review Date: 2014/09/17
Store: Vincent Tong  (Actor),     Kirby Morrow  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu Season One', "Since Lord Garmadon's disappearance from the Underworld, Ninjago has been at peace; but when Garmadon's son, Lloyd, releases the five ancient warring tribes of the Serpentine, the Ninja had to learn how to unlock their full potential in order to combat the growing threat. The Ninja also learned of a prophecy that one of them will become the Green Ninja – a warrior destined to defeat the Dark Lord in the ultimate battle of good versus evil. In the first season, the Ninjas unlocked their full elemental powers. Meanwhile, the Serpentine released the all-consuming snake known as the Great Devourer. In the climactic finale, the Ninja had to rely on Lord Garmadon and his ability to wield the Four Golden Weapons in order to destroy the Great Devourer and bring peace. In the end, the Ninja are heralded as heroes, but Lord Garmadon has disappeared with the very weapons he needed in order to turn Ninjago into his evil image.", ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Ninjago', 'is an action TV series that\'s based on the Lego toys and features the martial arts-inspired "spinjitzu": basically a combination of martial arts performed with weapons like swords, scythes, nunchucks, and shurikens combined with very fast spinning.', 'Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu, Season One', "begins after the series pilot episode and follows ninjas Kai, Cole, Jay, and Zane as they study their craft with Sensei Wu. The four hope to unleash their inner potential in preparation for defending the world against the return of the Dark Lord Garmadon. Prophecy states that one ninja will rise above the others to become the Green Ninja, who is destined to defeat Garmadon. Unfortunately, the four young ninjas are poorly disciplined and more interested in video games (Lego's", 'Ninjago', ", of course) and food fights than actual training. But when Garmadon's son Lloyd escapes from a boarding school for bad boys and accidentally releases an army of snakes, the ninjas suddenly have a reason to get serious about their training, as the snakes are a threat to the entire land of Ninjago. Sensei Wu is a wise teacher and the young ninjas develop their skills quickly, learning to use their four special weapons in a way that releases their elemental powers. But fate has a surprise for everyone when Lloyd is captured by the snakes and Sensei Wu informs the ninjas that they must rescue him. The question of which of the four ninjas will become the Green Ninja causes no end of bickering among the boys, even as they work together to rescue Lloyd and save Ninjago from the serpents. Interestingly, Kai's sister Nya also plays an unexpectedly important role in the mission to save Ninjago. The surprises just keep coming as five tribes of snakes band together in a quest to release an evil monster known as the Devourer, and eventually the ninjas find Lloyd training right alongside them. The action and suspense throughout this series is good, even if the ninjas often act like unruly prepubescent boys, and there are plenty of important life lessons woven throughout. (Ages 7 to 12)", '--Tami Horiuchi']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation, Comedy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Vincent Tong, IRENE SPARRE, Kirby Morrow, John Novak, Jillian Michaels, Erik Wilstrup, Colin Murdock, Michael Adamthwaite, Ian James Corlett, Torsten Jacobsen, Paul DobsonVincent Tong, IRENE SPARRE, Kirby Morrow, John Novak, Jillian Michaels, Erik Wilstrup, Colin Murdock, Michael Adamthwaite, Ian James Corlett, Torsten Jacobsen, Paul Dobson   See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '4 hours and 46 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25297567', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 26, 2012', 'Actors': 'Vincent Tong, Kirby Morrow, Michael Adamthwaite, Paul Dobson, Jillian Michaels', 'Producers': 'IRENE SPARRE, Torsten Jacobsen, Erik Wilstrup', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Seasons one and two are the best, can be viewed over and over without losing their charm.  By far the best movie series Lego has produced.  Good action pace, good graphics, engaging story lines, fun characters - seasons one and two are winners.
Review Title: Seasons one and two are the best, can be viewed over and over without losing ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu (DVD)
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video
['Product Description', 'LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu', 'Masters of Spinjitzu: a new force to save the world! The world of Ninjago is in terrible danger. An army of skeletons has invaded from the underworld, under the command of the evil Lord Garmadon. Their goal: capture the Four Weapons of Spinjitzu, artifacts so powerful it is said no one being can wield them all at once. Now Garmadon’s brother, the heroic Sensei Wu, must gather four young men and train them in the ways of the ancient art of Spinjitzu. These four – Kai, Jay, Zane and Cole – must become ninja and stand against the dark power of Garmadon and his evil skeleton army. If they fail, the four weapons will be lost and Ninjago doomed forever.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'The two-part adventure', 'Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu', "is based on a line of toys Lego introduced in 2011. Kai, a young blacksmith, is eager--too eager--to forge a great sword. He initially snubs the unassuming Sensei Wu, the master of Spinjitzu martial arts. When Kai's sister Nya is kidnapped by Samukai and his skeleton army from the Underworld, Wu realizes the evil Garmadon is using Samukai to find four legendary weapons that will give him enormous power. Wu trains Kai to join his student-warriors, Jay, Zane, and Cole, and keep Garmadon from seizing power.", 'Masters of Spinjitzu', "is a lightweight, product-based adventure, but it's not a terribly original one. The training sequence, which pits Kai against a series of armed mechanical devices, borrows heavily from", 'Kung Fu Panda', '. Other elements recall', 'Naruto', 'and', 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles', ', and the filmmakers blithely mix Chinese, Japanese, and Western elements. But little kids who love their Lego toys will probably overlook these shortcoming and enjoy the adventure, which is obviously designed to kick off a series. Parents should be prepared to field requests for the many toys that appear in', 'Masters of Spinjitzu', '. (Unrated; suitable for ages 5 and older: cartoon violence)', '--Charles Solomon']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25195594', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Animated', 'Run time': '44 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 27, 2012', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Our 5 year old grandson can't get enough of the Ninjago series.  I wish all of season 3 would be available in the USA, but apparently it's not.  (Why can other countries get it and we can't? Bummer!)  One thing I, as a septuagenarian adult, like very much is that the characters have a moral compass, even though there is the usual cartoon mayhem.  Also, the oriental aesthetic is a refreshing change from the ordinary cartoon graphics.  Well done.
From the grandparents of a 5 year old boy
LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu: Season 2
Michael Helmuth Hansen  (Director),     Trylle Vilstrup  (Director),     Vincent Tong  (Actor),     Kirby Morrow  (Actor)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Musicals & Performing Arts
['LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu Season Two', 'Since Lord Garmadon’s disappearance from the Underworld, Ninjago has been at peace; but when Garmadon’s son, Lloyd, releases the five ancient warring tribes of the Serpentine, the Ninja had to learn how to unlock their full potential in order to combat the growing threat. The Ninja also learned of a prophecy that one of them will become the Green Ninja – a warrior destined to defeat the Dark Lord in the ultimate battle of good versus evil. In the first season, the Ninjas unlocked their full elemental powers. Meanwhile, the Serpentine released the all-consuming snake known as the Great Devourer. In the climactic finale, the Ninja had to rely on Lord Garmadon and his ability to wield the Four Golden Weapons in order to destroy the Great Devourer and bring peace. In the end, the Ninja are heralded as heroes, but Lord Garmadon has disappeared with the very weapons he needed in order to turn Ninjago into his evil image.', ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Brian Drummond, IRENE SPARRE, John Novak, Mark Oliver, Trylle Vilstrup, Erik Wilstrup, Michael Adamthwaite, Martin Skov, Michael Helmuth Hansen, Vincent Tong, Mackenzie Gray, Kirby Morrow, Jillian Michaels, Kelly Metzger, Colin Murdock, Brent Miller, Torsten Jacobsen, Paul DobsonBrian Drummond, IRENE SPARRE, John Novak, Mark Oliver, Trylle Vilstrup, Erik Wilstrup, Michael Adamthwaite, Martin Skov, Michael Helmuth Hansen, Vincent Tong, Mackenzie Gray, Kirby Morrow, Jillian Michaels, Kelly Metzger, Colin Murdock, Brent Miller, Torsten Jacobsen…  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26337710', 'Director': 'Michael Helmuth Hansen, Trylle Vilstrup, Martin Skov', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 5, 2013', 'Actors': 'Vincent Tong, Kirby Morrow, Michael Adamthwaite, Brent Miller, Paul Dobson', 'Producers': 'IRENE SPARRE, Torsten Jacobsen, Erik Wilstrup', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '2'}
This is a great fantasy series which grandparents can enjoy with their lego-obsessed grandsons, then go out and get some of the sets and build the vehicles etc.  Not lacking in moral content, either.  The boy is going to be Lloyd, the green ninja, this halloween.
This is a great fantasy series which grandparents can enjoy with their lego-obsessed ...

profile:
The user has a strong affinity for family-friendly entertainment, particularly animated series that engage younger audiences with action-packed narratives and moral themes. Their recent interaction with a highly-rated animated series underscores their commitment to content that combines ethical lessons with fun, reflecting their thoughtful approach to children's programming. They place a high value on character integrity and enjoy diverse cultural elements in animation, seeking rich visual and thematic diversity.

As a septuagenarian, the user finds joy in sharing modern shows with their grandchildren, emphasizing the importance of accessibility to high-quality content, even in the face of regional limitations. Their enthusiastic perspectives highlight the appeal of shared experiences and creativity, particularly regarding series with popular themes. They appreciate engaging storylines, lively characters, and the appeal of rewatchable content that maintains its charm over time.

Overall, the user actively seeks animated series that not only captivate young viewers but also resonate with older generations, ensuring meaningful lessons and enjoyment across age groups. Their preferences revolve around media that fosters family bonding and showcases exciting action intertwined with foundational values, making it suitable for collaborative family viewing experiences.
